intro: Zygia trunciflora, commonly known as the narrow-leaved zygia, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family, which includes many species with unique floral structures. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves that are often truncate at the base. Its flowers are small and clustered in cyathia, a type of cup-like structure typical of the Euphorbiaceae family. Zygia trunciflora is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest undergrowth.
